commit_message:
Remove cinder_glance_api_version option

glance_api_version option is deprecated in Cinder from 11.0.0 (Pike), so
remove from OSA-os_cinder and related option: cinder_glance_api_version.

Change-Id: Ie1c549461cfd6799d7535fda673b8c3872afe4af
Closes-bug: #1692750

commit_message:
Remove log translations

The i18n team has decided not to translate the logs because it seems
like it not very useful; operators prefer to have them in English so
that they can search for those strings on the internet.

Change-Id: I9731b86dddd9483327bf1039abaf321daabaa266
Closes-Bug: #1674546

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated.
This removes all use of the _LE, _LI, and _LW
translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I4f0d38c21c169a01b54ced0219aeb2b717a27a5e

commit_message:
add rhn repo support to repo-setup role

This change enables rhn production public yum repos for RHOSP.
The username, password, pool-id and versions are all configurable.
It is left to the user to define pre and post actions in the config
itself like any other yum repo. An example configuration file will
be provided.

Change-Id: Id1bb6b7f32b01f33a22d3da405d90c29d5d7f551

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-31 10:48:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/8d0509748a7efd26d09d07941eae390e627d9c72', 'message': 'Restrict nova migration ssh tunnel

This change enhances the security of the migration ssh tunnel:
- The ssh authorized_keys file is only writeable by root.
- Creates a new user for migration instead of using root/nova.
- Disables SSH forwarding for this user.
- Optionally restricts the networks that this user can connect from.
- Uses an ssh wrapper command to whitelist the commands that this user can run

commit_message:
Restrict nova migration ssh tunnel

This change enhances the security of the migration ssh tunnel:
- The ssh authorized_keys file is only writeable by root.
- Creates a new user for migration instead of using root/nova.
- Disables SSH forwarding for this user.
- Optionally restricts the networks that this user can connect from.
- Uses an ssh wrapper command to whitelist the commands that this user can run
  over ssh.

Requires the openstack-nova-migration package from
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/6327

bp tripleo-cold-migration

Change-Id: Idb56acd1e1ecb5a5fd4d942969be428cc9cbe293
(cherry picked from commit f8ca94a5b7c7658631f5b0a9b010251ebbcff65e)

commit_message:
Refactor resource.py/Resource

Create a class of 'Recource' to replace the original definition.
It will bring several advantages.

1. The new class will be used as tuple which can't be modified,
accessed by name or index.

2. The instance of new class can be hashable whatever the type of
members of instace. So, it can be used in method of 'build_graph'.

3. Add some other functions to it, such as transform it to dict.

4. It is easy to chose members of it to be serialized by modifing
the definition of property of 'Resource'.

Change-Id: Ib5f3fea53bff9fe0a7c3b88339af26b70a6b7d3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/50/454150/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: return dict(id=resource_instance.id, name=resource_instance.name, type=resource_instance.type, extra_info=resource_instance.extra_info) name="", extra_info=None) result = [] for resource in dependent_resources: result.append(dict(type=resource.type, id=resource.id, name=resource.name, extra_info=resource.extra_info)) return result

Like in other models, the decision whether the object is created or

commit_message:
[01/xx] Move update/create decision logic from lport to df controller

Like in other models, the decision whether the object is created or
updated should be done in the DF controller. This change moves the logic
from lport's emit_update method to the DF controller's
_logical_port_process method.

This is part of a long chain of changes to solve bug 1690775.

Change-Id: I768e497fd94390c619a7b24941de10dc2e268241
Related-Bug: #1690775
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/35/468735/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: original_lport = self.db_store2.get_one(lport) self.db_store2.update(lport) if original_lport is None: lport.emit_created() else: lport.emit_updated(original_lport)

can be used in Nova.

commit_message:
Bump oslo.config to 4.0.0

We make set_override/set_default with enforce_type=True by default,
in Ifa552de0a994e40388cbc9f7dbaa55700ca276b0, this will help use
correct config option's value in unit test.

Change-Id: I361aa552d30968d445dbb2e4bc0b336e2bc15dab

commit_message:
Add a verification about restore's parameter

The restore properties of restore's parameter have not been
checked. The restore property value should be one of the pr
operties in restore_schema of the plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1686709
Change-Id: I910f74fb4254951b399980c1cd616abc354392a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/04/460604/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.validate_restore_parameters(context, restore) def validate_restore_parameters(self, context, plan): parameters = plan["parameters"] if not parameters: return restore_schema = None provider = self.protection_api.show_provider( context, plan["provider_id"]) extended_info_schema = provider.get("extended_info_schema", None) if extended_info_schema: restore_schema = extended_info_schema.get("restore_schema", None) for resource_key, parameter_value in parameters.items(): if "#" in resource_key: resource_type, resource_id = resource_key.split("#") if not uuidutils.is_uuid_like(resource_id): msg = _("The resource_id must be a uuid.") raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=msg) else: resource_type = resource_key if resource_type not in constants.RESOURCE_TYPES: msg = _("The key of restore parameters is invalid.") raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=msg) property_list = parameter_value.keys() if restore_schema: properties = restore_schema[resource_type]["properties"] property_list_schema = properties.keys() if not set(property_list_schema) > set(property_list): msg = _("The protect property of restore parameters " "is invalid.") raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=msg)

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

Oslo.config deprecated parameter enforce_type and change
its default value to True. Remove the usage of it to avoid
DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type' argument is
deprecated in version '4.0' and will be removed in version
'5.0': The argument enforce_type has changed its default
value to True and then will be removed completely."

Change-Id: I59621664773ee5ad264e6da9b15231f30dbb9c40
Closes-Bug: #1694616

commit_message:
Add tempest test for container commit

Change-Id: I81b3516dc2352051279d8633896657f1ffb840fd
Partial-Implements: blueprint zun-functional-test
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/28/468728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from zun.tests.tempest import utils @decorators.idempotent_id('c3f02fa0-fdfb-49fc-95e2-6e4dc982f9be') def test_commit_container(self): """Test container snapshot This test does the following: 1. Create a container 2. Create and write to a file inside the container 3. Commit the container and upload the snapshot to Glance 4. Create another container from the snapshot image 5. Verify the pre-created file is there """ # This command creates a file inside the container command = "/bin/sh -c 'echo hello > testfile;sleep 1000000'" _, model = self._run_container(command=command) try: resp, _ = self.container_client.commit_container( model.uuid, params={'repository': 'myrepo'}) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) self._ensure_image_active('myrepo') # This command outputs the content of pre-created file command = "/bin/sh -c 'cat testfile;sleep 1000000'" _, model = self._run_container( image="myrepo", image_driver="glance", command=command) resp, body = self.container_client.logs_container(model.uuid) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertTrue('hello' in body) finally: try: response = self.images_client.list_images() for image in response['images']: if (image['name'] == 'myrepo' and image['container_format'] == 'docker'): self.images_client.delete_image(image['id']) except Exception: pass def _ensure_image_active(self, image_name): def is_image_in_desired_state(): response = self.images_client.list_images() for image in response['images']: if (image['name'] == image_name and image['container_format'] == 'docker' and image['status'] == 'active'): return True return False utils.wait_for_condition(is_image_in_desired_state)

subject: Change the tempest test interval to 2s.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-01 02:24:12.000000000', 'files': ['zun/tests/tempest/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun/commit/e60649e08ce6b1b01d1480bc06433007c9c320ee', 'message': 'Change the tempest test interval to 2s.

Always seen tempest test fail with api timeout error. Refer to
http://logs.openstack.org/42/469342/2/check/
gate-zun-devstack-dsvm-docker-sql/02b4650/
logs/apache/zun_api.txt.gz#_2017-05-31_08_29_52_459
But run the tempest in local devstack, the logs show there are
lots of rabbitmq messages and seems the rabbitmq cannot handle
so much message. Checked the code there are lots of check status
called in tempest test.

So this patch propose to change the check status interval to 2s
to reduce the numbers of messages to avoid rabbitmq message stuck.

Change-Id: Ibb41ae552bcce0f685834e13a6c3a5836f657cab
'}]
commit_message:
Change the tempest test interval to 2s.

Always seen tempest test fail with api timeout error. Refer to
http://logs.openstack.org/42/469342/2/check/
gate-zun-devstack-dsvm-docker-sql/02b4650/
logs/apache/zun_api.txt.gz#_2017-05-31_08_29_52_459
But run the tempest in local devstack, the logs show there are
lots of rabbitmq messages and seems the rabbitmq cannot handle
so much message. Checked the code there are lots of check status
called in tempest test.

So this patch propose to change the check status interval to 2s
to reduce the numbers of messages to avoid rabbitmq message stuck.

Change-Id: Ibb41ae552bcce0f685834e13a6c3a5836f657cab

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

Oslo.config deprecated parameter enforce_type and change its default
value to True in Ifa552de0a994e40388cbc9f7dbaa55700ca276b0. Remove the
usage of it to avoid DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type'
argument is deprecated in version '4.0' and will be removed in version
'5.0': The argument enforce_type has changed its default value to True
and then will be removed completely."

Change-Id: I88f194e966aad5761753554515bfa787f2fb5798

subject: XenAPI: nova-compute cannot restart after manually delete VM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-25 08:30:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1611f8954fd1e2d0c4cbafd5fd7b864703d5174f', 'message': "XenAPI: Fix vif plug problem

When we manually delete a VM which is created by OpenStack, then if
we stop and start nova-compute service again, we will fail to start
nova-compute service, this is because during starting of nova-compute
it will try to init al VMs and plug vif. Since the VM is already
deleted manually, it cannot find the VM via xapi which is fine, but
the code didn't return and continute to plug VIF with the *empty*
VM and meet un-predictable exception and thus make the nova-compute
service failed to run. This patch is to fix this problem by add a
proper exception when it cannot find VM via xapi.

Closes-bug: #1693147

Change-Id: I937f5c202c9a4892e8aa56f74fad125791809f8c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-25 08:36:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d03223a9bc0a9df90e21f0c3f6fa7f5a3970671a', 'message': "XenAPI: nova-compute cannot restart after manually delete VM

When we manually delete a VM which is created by OpenStack, then if
we stop and start nova-compute service again, we will fail to start
nova-compute service, this is because during starting of nova-compute
it will try to init al VMs and plug vif. Since the VM is already
deleted manually, it cannot find the VM via xapi which is fine, but
the code didn't return and continute to plug VIF with the *empty*
VM and meet un-predictable exception and thus make the nova-compute
service failed to run. This patch is to fix this problem by add a
proper exception when it cannot find VM via xapi.

Closes-bug: #1693147

Change-Id: I937f5c202c9a4892e8aa56f74fad125791809f8c
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-26 01:24:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b6ca66c73c42a2f90cf9370ec53c9df577038d20', 'message': "XenAPI: nova-compute cannot restart after manually delete VM

When a VM is deleted accidentally (e.g. hardware problem, manually),
the VM's information is still in nova DB and nova believes the VM
exist, then if we stop and start nova-compute service again, it will
fail to start because when starting of nova-compute, it will try to
init al VMs and plug VIFs. Since the VM isn't exist at hypervisor's
perspective of view, it cannot find the VM via xapi (which is fine).
But the code didn't return and continute to plug VIF with the *empty*
VM and meet un-predictable exception and thus make the nova-compute
service failed to run. This patch is to fix this problem by add a
proper exception when it cannot find VM via xapi.

Closes-bug: #1693147

Change-Id: I937f5c202c9a4892e8aa56f74fad125791809f8c
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-30 10:26:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vif.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vif.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/92d8103a196c25157295789100117946dcf67304', 'message': 'XenAPI: nova-compute cannot restart after manually delete VM

When a VM is deleted accidentally (e.g. hardware problem or manually
through the hypervisor rather than Nova), there is a mis-match of
information where the VM is still in nova DB but not the hypervisor.
If we start nova-compute service in this setup, it will fail due to an
untrapped exception when plugging VIFs.

Return an expected exception when Nova cannot find VM via xapi.

Closes-bug: #1693147

Change-Id: I937f5c202c9a4892e8aa56f74fad125791809f8c
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: nova-compute cannot restart after manually delete VM

When a VM is deleted accidentally (e.g. hardware problem or manually
through the hypervisor rather than Nova), there is a mis-match of
information where the VM is still in nova DB but not the hypervisor.
If we start nova-compute service in this setup, it will fail due to an
untrapped exception when plugging VIFs.

Return an expected exception when Nova cannot find VM via xapi.

Closes-bug: #1693147

Change-Id: I937f5c202c9a4892e8aa56f74fad125791809f8c

commit_message:
Switch the ovb-containers-oooq to use network iso

This patch enables network isolation for the OVB
containers oooq job. This is to provide similar coverage
to the nonha job which this replaces.

Change-Id: I42a5667770f327a973f2661f7ad3a844610f6327

commit_message:
Increase default for NovaReservedHostMemory to 4096

Idle compute nodes are found to already consume ~1.5GB of memory, so
2GB is a bit tight.  Increasing to 4GB to be on the safe side.  Also
see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1341178

Change-Id: Ic95984b62a748593992446271b197439fa12b376

commit_message:
Compile stats on server side

Currently, we let server to return the raw stats
and compile them at client side. It would be better
to move the compilation of stats from zunclient to
server. At zunclient, it should just print whatever
output server returned.

Change-Id: I6cd50755bbd4d1a1a124e36759ab1a7e71d20dda
Closes-Bug: #1692732

commit_message:
Neutron fixes; fix external and tunnel interfaces.

Fixes to resolve confusion between gotpl and bash variable handling
and also how bash handles empty strings.

These are required to robustly:
 1. make use of an external network (for floating IPs)
 2. specify *which* interface in the nodes is used for the tunnelled
    traffic.

Change-Id: I30fd675cd471a77dc09a6c7f6ee81120a978b38b

commit_message:
Add volume type filter to API Get-Pools

Add feature that administrators can get back-end storage pools
filtered by volume-type, Cinder will return the pools filtered
by volume-type's extra-spec. This is depended on generalized
resource filtering feature.

APIImpact
Depends-On: ff3d41b15abb2915de87830980147be51e5da971
Implements: blueprint add-volume-type-filter-to-get-pool

Change-Id: If2ae4616340d061db833cbbdffc77f3e976d8254

added_lines: from cinder.volume import volume_types def _filter_pools_by_volume_type(self, context, volume_type, pools): """Return the pools filtered by volume type specs""" # wrap filter properties only with volume_type filter_properties = { 'context': context, 'volume_type': volume_type, 'resource_type': volume_type, 'qos_specs': volume_type['qos_specs'], } filtered = self.get_filtered_backends(pools.values(), filter_properties) # filter the pools by value return {k: v for k, v in pools.items() if v in filtered} all_pools = {} if filters and filters.get('name'): all_pools[pool_key] = pool # filter pools by volume type if filters and filters.get('volume_type'): volume_type = volume_types.get_by_name_or_id( context, filters.get('volume_type')) all_pools = ( self._filter_pools_by_volume_type(context, volume_type, all_pools)) # encapsulate pools in format:{name: XXX, capabilities: XXX} return [dict(name=key, capabilities=value.capabilities) for key, value in all_pools.items()]
deleted_lines: all_pools = [] if filters: all_pools.append(new_pool) return all_pools

commit_message:
Test coverage for network v2 subnets_client

According to the tempest lib documentation [0]:

"When adding a new interface to the library we need to at a
minimum have unit test coverage. A proposed change to add
an interface to tempest/lib that doesn't have unit tests
shouldn't be accepted. Ideally these unit tests will provide
sufficient coverage to ensure a stable interface moving forward."

Thus test coverage should be provided for existing clients in
tempest.lib that lack unit tests. This patch adds test coverage
for network v2 subnets_client.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/library.html#testing

Partially Implements: blueprint tempest-lib-missing-test-coverage
Change-Id: I5eadecf3c45c92a2bc058d093123014f04a2b781

commit_message:
Fix url in list_services

This commit fixes list_services by changing the url passed to self.get
from 'services' to url, because url can concatenate **params
to 'services'.

Change-Id: I2e2ebb72732ab95d5f9c1d988037c5e263bf2a71

commit_message:
Fix ceph client virsh secret check

Previously we were not stripping whitespace or newlines
from the value returned from virsh secret-get-value which
resulted in the key comparison always returning False and
services being restarted.

Change-Id: If465183860dc9d6e13c81d363791c06c0e5adb76
Closes-Bug: 1694963

commit_message:
Consistency: Move Mistral container start commands to scripts

This PS moves the container start commands to scripts. This brings
the service into alignment with others in OpenStack-Helm, and enables
easier debugging and modifcation of the launch commands for services.

Change-Id: I1d063eaf1c15d94bc14988affbcedb627aa8c212

commit_message:
Periodic task to clean expired reservation

Now there is no way to clean the expired reservation.
This patch added a periodic task in cinder-scheduler to
do the cleanup like Nova does.

Change-Id: Id792db968ed2fe8e01c64e24d99c9ebadc3232b7
Closes-bug: #1693401
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/67/467867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('reservation_clean_interval', default=86400, help='interval between periodic task runs to clean expired ' 'reservation in seconds.'),

commit_message:
Log specific error message from RetriableConnectionFailure

There are more than one error from keystoneauth that can match
RetriableConnectionFailure. We retry on all of them, but logging the
whole message can be useful for debugging.

Change-Id: I2fd3bf62a3a755281d34ff5d3624b835281604fb

commit_message:
Fix docs by limiting sphinx requirement to <1.6.1

The gate pulls the latest sphinx package, 1.6.2 at the moment,
which, just like the ignored version 1.6.1, seems to break
the docs environment.

This patch thus limits sphinx to <1.6.1 instead of simply !=1.6.1.

Related-Bug: #1693010
Change-Id: I30f2ac347d0a02ba9cac3665404c94582f6e0385

Client support for service force-down

This patch adds support for service force-down.

Partially-Implements: blueprint enhance-service-api

added_lines: def force_down(self, host, binary, force_down=None): """Force service state to down specified by hostname and binary.""" body = self._update_body(host, binary, force_down=force_down) return self._action("/force_down", qparams=body)

commit_message:
Switch to 'eventlet' executor for rpc

The default rpc executor is 'blocking' which might have a deadlock
issue on the latest version of olso.messaging

Depends-On: I147d566f08b5b9cd3beac3c26dfbefa2ddb1c5fb
Change-Id: I72021b5cd90ce9425685edcb5cdee4e1263b94bf

commit_message:
Ban neutronclient 6.3.0

It looks both kuryr-libnetwork and zun gates are broken by the
release of neutronclient 6.3.0:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1694897

This commit proposes to temporarily ban 6.3.0 to unblock the
gate.

Change-Id: I147d566f08b5b9cd3beac3c26dfbefa2ddb1c5fb
Related-Bug: #1694897

See tripleo-heat-templates # for more details. # Defaults to hiera('step') # class tripleo::profile::base::neutron::lbaas( $manage_service = undef, $enabled = undef, $step = hiera('step'), ) { include ::tripleo::profile::base::neutron if $step >= 4 { if hiera('neutron::enable_lbaas_agent', false) { include ::neutron::services::lbaas class {'::neutron::agents::lbaas': manage_service => false, enabled => false, manage_haproxy_package => false, enable_v1 => false, enable_v2 => true, } } # Optional since manage_service may be false and neutron server may not be colocated. commit_message:
Update gitignore not to exclude fixture hieradata

The existing .gitignore is causing the hieradata we use for tests to be
excluded in git and our release tarballs. Lets adjust the gitignore not
to exclude the hiera files in spec/fixtures

Change-Id: Ic31687d0eb1c2e8acc92796d4c0eba096db8e533
Closes-Bug: #1691559
(cherry picked from commit 66b6ea166c0f8470170f6e07843ff41068d8e9e9)

commit_message:
Add global_request_id to systemd logs

With cinder supporting this now, start logging global_request_id in
systemd logs. It will be None for all the services until the work
starts coming together, but it is safe to do.

Change-Id: Ic6ba1a42da88c03e43d89658b453f6a0b353e0db

commit_message:
Update the host_id for network:router_gateway interfaces

The ports owned by a router_gateway need to get its host_id property
updated during the failover of a router. Otherwise the port connected
to the external network will always have its host_id set to the value
obtained during creation.

Change-Id: I5eca20e3cc64d7a9e52b0556a3cadd29eb4c821d
Closes-Bug: 1694337

subject: Deploy keystone running in uwsgi proxy by apache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 17:01:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/6aa886a188a5d14035c34fbc3d82d675edf1333a', 'message': "Deploy keystone running in uwsgi proxy by apache

Provide a deployment option where keystone runs in uwsgi accepting
on a uwsgi port, while apache accepts client connections and
forwards requests onto the uwsgi server.

There's a few advantages here. You can restart keystone
independently of other servers. You can use pdb on keystone easily
since it's a separate process.

To deploy this way, set KEYSTONE_DEPLOY=uwsgi_proxy

Change-Id: Ia1f789392b7147439123d9839e611a24a8bd50af

under uwsgi using the uwsgi protocol and apache httpd forwards HTTP

independently of other servers. You can use pdb on keystone easily
since it's a separate process.

commit_message:
Deploy keystone running in uwsgi proxy by apache

Change the keystone "uwsgi" deployment:

 - keystone runs under uWSGI listening on a local unix sockets.
 - Apache httpd forwards client requests to :5000, :35357, /identity,
   and /identity_admin to the appropriate uwsgi keystone socket using
   mod_proxy_http.

There's a few advantages here. You can restart keystone
independently of other servers. You can use pdb on keystone easily
since it's a separate process.

Note: I tried to use uwsgi over a unix socket, which would have
been a little nicer since I wouldn't have to set admin_endpoint and
public_endpoint, but it looks like there's a bug in the ubuntu
mod_proxy_uwsgi: see
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=752783
The workaround is to use http over a unit socket.

Change-Id: Ia1f789392b7147439123d9839e611a24a8bd50af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/17/291817/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Listen %PUBLICPORT% Listen %ADMINPORT% LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-agent}i\" %D(us)" keystone_combined <VirtualHost *:%PUBLICPORT%> ProxyPass / uwsgi://127.0.0.1:%INTERNAL_PUBLICPORT%/ ErrorLogFormat "%M" ErrorLog /var/log/%APACHE_NAME%/keystone.log CustomLog /var/log/%APACHE_NAME%/keystone_access.log keystone_combined %SSLENGINE% %SSLCERTFILE% %SSLKEYFILE% </VirtualHost> <VirtualHost *:%ADMINPORT%> ProxyPass / uwsgi://127.0.0.1:%INTERNAL_ADMINPORT%/ ErrorLogFormat "%M" ErrorLog /var/log/%APACHE_NAME%/keystone.log CustomLog /var/log/%APACHE_NAME%/keystone_access.log keystone_combined %SSLENGINE% %SSLCERTFILE% %SSLKEYFILE% </VirtualHost> ProxyPass /identity uwsgi://127.0.0.1:%INTERNAL_PUBLICPORT%/ ProxyPass /identity_admin uwsgi://127.0.0.1:%INTERNAL_ADMINPORT%/

commit_message:
Skip StackSnapshotRestoreTest

Change Ica5f87614f5fb98f253d65cbd4355dcc7c6714eb adds it to the
list of scenario tests to skip, whereas it's a functional test.

Related-Bug: #1694371

Change-Id: I84e806bad284cffb32e68fef6b14dfff11dba846
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/65/469765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $conf_file heat_plugin skip_functional_test_list 'CancelUpdateTest.test_cancel_update_server_with_port, StackSnapshotRestoreTest'iniset $conf_file heat_plugin skip_scenario_test_list 'SoftwareConfigIntegrationTest, VolumeBackupRestoreIntegrationTest'
deleted_lines: iniset $conf_file heat_plugin skip_functional_test_list 'CancelUpdateTest.test_cancel_update_server_with_port'iniset $conf_file heat_plugin skip_scenario_test_list 'SoftwareConfigIntegrationTest, VolumeBackupRestoreIntegrationTest, StackSnapshotRestoreTest'

commit_message:
remove send-announcements-to field

We no longer use the send-announcements-to field for anything.

Change-Id: I548514a20bfcae6b57065c44e6f4832c27a4cea0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Move subscriber recv logic outside specific drivers

This patch removes the knowledge of update object structure from subscriber
drivers.

Change-Id: I6bb833e17084ac690dd003c21cb157c72cf27ddd

commit_message:
Make remaining volumeMounts readOnly

This cleanup adds a readOnly tag for the remaining volumeMounts
across the project.

Change-Id: I1035c075c2e0c6f2b1b76a14e45094ed4e90a879

subject: neutron: new stable releases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-26 21:26:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/fa7190b474c4c025064432f167e2e2c391ab45bd', 'message': 'neutron: new stable releases

The Newton release is the last that allowed non-critical bug fixes. Its
minor version is bumped (not patch version) because of a new
"feature-ish" backport (keepalived health check; disabled by default).

commit_message:
neutron: new stable releases

The Newton release is the last that allowed non-critical bug fixes. Its
minor version is bumped (not patch version) because of a new
"feature-ish" backport (keepalived health check; disabled by default).

Change-Id: I2cb192d3e33dbbb50a4ed6c44ff7153a98825358
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/52/468552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - version: 9.4.0 projects: - repo: openstack/neutron hash: 5c3203fc1e3f628007ebb844464b1e71e84f37d0 highlights: |- * Add support for Keepalived VRRP health check * Optimized locking in DHCP agent * Multiple OVSDB timeout fixes * Remove stale floating IP addresses from rfp devices * Dont try to apply iptables rules in a endless loop * Stop killing conntrack state without CT Zone * Avoid resync loop if router fails to initialize

commit_message:
placement: test non-shared out of inventory

Adds another functional test scenario that stresses the SQL that
filters out resource providers that are associated with a shared
provider of some resource but are out of capacity for a local resource.

Change-Id: I51ec2500c0aaf23b2837255662c45f4b6b7cc09e
blueprint: shared-resources-pike
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/00/461900/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Now we consume all the memory in the second compute node and verify # that it does not get returned from _get_all_with_shared() for x in range(3): # allocation_ratio for MEMORY_MB is 1.5, so we need to make 3 # 512-MB allocations to fully consume the memory on the node memory_mb_alloc = objects.Allocation( resource_provider=cn2, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, consumer_id='consumer%d' % x, used=512, ) alloc_list = objects.AllocationList( self.context, objects=[memory_mb_alloc] ) alloc_list.create_all() got_rps = rp_obj.ResourceProviderList._get_all_with_shared( self.context, resources, ) got_ids = [rp.id for rp in got_rps] self.assertEqual([cn1.id], got_ids)

deleted_lines: # Development Environment Setup ## Requirements * Hardware * 16GB RAM * 32GB HDD Space * Software * Vagrant >= 1.8.0 * VirtualBox >= 5.1.0 * Kubectl * Helm * Git ## Deploy * Make sure you are in the directory containing the Vagrantfile before running the following commands. ### Create VM ``` bash vagrant up --provider virtualbox ``` ### Deploy NFS Provisioner for development PVCs ``` bash vagrant ssh --command "sudo docker exec kubeadm-aio kubectl create -R -f /opt/nfs-provisioner/" ``` ### Setup Clients and deploy Helm's tiller ``` bash ./setup-dev-host.sh ``` ### Label VM node(s) for OpenStack-Helm Deployment ``` bash kubectl label nodes openstack-control-plane=enabled --all --namespace=openstack kubectl label nodes openvswitch=enabled --all --namespace=openstack kubectl label nodes openstack-compute-node=enabled --all --namespace=openstack ```

commit_message:
Fix attribute errors in os-auth-* settings

This fixes some wording and formatting issues with the help
text that is printed for CLI arguments.

The duplication of default values for os-auth-system appears
to lead to attribute errors requiring explicitly unsetting
OS_AUTH_TYPE.

Closes-bug: #1695054
Change-Id: I0263ef2fb15744f7e352c7365e7d9e61c1ebc974

commit_message:
use block literal instead of folding markup to preserve inline rst

Replace > with | to ensure the inline reStructuredText is escaped
properly.

Change-Id: Id30888b77f46b1f163c0a8175033b96aa3f9bff8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
remove cap on pysnmp from global-requirements.txt

The cap was added in a time it was considered the norm four years ago.
The cap has never restricted anything (the current version in
upper-constraints.txt is the latest), so let's bring it in line with
the general policy of not having caps.

Change-Id: Ie804bc9d758a5f19d2bfc9e02cabe1bd0a2ac8a9

commit_message:
WIP: Kolla image build

Change-Id: Iae8fe3f97852449b7f1c3d35f5884ab77c85a01f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/06/468506/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM ubuntu:16.04 MAINTAINER pete.birley@att.com ENV KOLLA_BASE=ubuntu \ KOLLA_TYPE=source \ KOLLA_TAG=newton \ KOLLA_PROJECT=keystone \ KOLLA_NAMESPACE=kolla \ KOLLA_VERSION=4.0.0 \ DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive RUN set -x \ && apt-get update \ && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y \ build-essential \ git \ python-dev \ python-pip \ docker.io \ && pip --no-cache-dir install --upgrade pip \ && pip --no-cache-dir install setuptools \ && git clone http://git.openstack.org/openstack/kolla.git /opt/kolla \ && cd /opt/kolla \ && git checkout tags/$KOLLA_VERSION \ && pip --no-cache-dir install . ADD ./assets / RUN kolla-build --config-file /etc/kolla/kolla.conf --template-only --template-override /etc/kolla/template-overrides.j2 \ && mv /tmp/kolla-*/* /opt/ \ && cat /opt/docker/base/Dockerfile

commit_message:
Drop support for Ubuntu precise

Ubuntu 12.04 LTS reached its regular End of Life on April 28, 2017.

Depends-On: I5e145095a10db112bb27516bfe652d2cdc052a61
Change-Id: I64af4c5183d77a75dcd062895d19b0a1330c8da8

commit_message:
Add guideline to upgrade for Operators

This patch set will add a document guideline
to upgrade for Operators.

Change-Id: Id405801b58e3d8c799794b29dbcb8e14cf4f0cc6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/22/449022/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _upgrade_guide: ================================= Key Manager Service Upgrade Guide ================================= This document outlines several steps and noted for operator to reference when upgrading their barbican from previous versions of Openstack. Plan to Upgrade =============== * The `release note <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/barbican/>`_ should be read carefully first when upgrading the barbican services. Starting with the Mitaka release, specific upgrade steps and considerations are well-documented in the release notes. * Upgrades are only supported one series at the time, or within a series. * When upgrading barbican, the following steps should be noted: #. Upgrade barbican code, without stopping services. #. Destroy all services in barbican #. Run database migrations. #. Restart the services Upgrading from Newton to Ocata ============================== There are no specific upgrade instructions other than the `Ocata release notes <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/barbican/ocata.html#upgrade-notes>`_. Upgrade from Mitaka to Newton ============================= There are no information needed to note at this cycle Upgrade from Liberty to Mitaka ============================== There are no specific upgrade instructions other than the `Ocata release notes <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/barbican/mitaka.html#upgrade-notes>`_.

subject: Tri-state checkbox widget
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-19 14:55:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard/commit/7d6d670e1251e38ca907744b4a7529cc608ae89d', 'message': 'Tri-state checkbox widget

Tri-state checkbox is the kind of checkbox which has three states instead
of two, as the regular checkbox has.

Third state is "indeterminate", which means, that that element is in undefined
state. Common example of such situation is some parent element, which has
some of child elements selected and some not - and so it means that parent
element is not selected nor unselect - which in terminology of this changeset
called "indeterminate" state.

Change-Id: I98116fce362af5eb4c64941f4c442dd81120e762

commit_message:
Tri-state checkbox widget

Tri-state checkbox is the kind of checkbox which has three states
instead of two, as the regular checkbox has.

Third state is "indeterminate", which means, that the element is in
undefined state. Common example of such situation is some parent
element, which has some of child elements selected and some not - and
so it means that parent element is not selected nor unselect - which
in terminology of this changeset called "indeterminate" state.

Partially implements bp assign-category-button
Depends-On: Ie65a77eab29aa191420fbd630b1d242b59c9ff9f
Change-Id: I98116fce362af5eb4c64941f4c442dd81120e762
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/15/175215/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <input type="checkbox" {% for attr, value in attrs.iteritems %} {% if attr != 'name' and attr != 'id' and attr != 'value' %} {{ attr }}="{{ value }}" {% endif %} {% endfor %} /> <input type="hidden" {% if attrs.id %} id="{{ attrs.id }}_{{ forloop.counter }} {% endif %} {% for attr, value in attrs.iteritems %} {{ attr }}="{{ value }}" {% endfor %} name="{{ name }}" value="{{ choice }}={{ value }}" />

commit_message:
placement: tests for non-shared with shared

Adds some more functional tests for the _get_all_with_shared() function
that tests an environment with both shared resource providers and
resource providers with "local" resources.

We create a compute node not associated with any aggregate and having
"local" disk storage and verify this compute node is returned along
with compute nodes with shared storage via an aggregate association.

We then allocate against this compute node with "local" disk storage,
consuming all the vCPU and RAM on the compute node (but not disk) and
verify that the node is no longer returned from _get_all_with_shared()

Change-Id: I3e4bc1d0dd5a71668265033dbdf9960f789cded0
blueprint: shared-resources-pike
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/99/461899/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Now we add another compute node that has vCPU and RAM along with # local disk and is *not* associated with the agg1. We want to verify # that this compute node, because it has all three resources "locally" # is also returned by _get_all_with_shared() along with the other # compute nodes that are associated with the shared storage pool. cn3_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn3 cn3 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='cn3', uuid=cn3_uuid, ) cn3.create() vcpu = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn3, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, total=24, reserved=0, min_unit=1, max_unit=24, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=1.0, ) memory_mb = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn3, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, total=1024, reserved=0, min_unit=64, max_unit=1024, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=1.0, ) disk_gb = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn3, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=500, reserved=0, min_unit=10, max_unit=500, step_size=10, allocation_ratio=1.0, ) inv_list = objects.InventoryList(objects=[vcpu, memory_mb, disk_gb]) cn3.set_inventory(inv_list) got_rps = rp_obj.ResourceProviderList._get_all_with_shared( self.context, resources, ) got_ids = [rp.id for rp in got_rps] self.assertEqual([cn1.id, cn2.id, cn3.id], got_ids) # Consume all vCPU and RAM inventory on the "local disk" compute node # and verify it no longer is returned from _get_all_with_shared() vcpu_alloc = objects.Allocation( resource_provider=cn3, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, consumer_id=uuidsentinel.consumer, used=24, ) memory_mb_alloc = objects.Allocation( resource_provider=cn3, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, consumer_id=uuidsentinel.consumer, used=1024, ) alloc_list = objects.AllocationList( self.context, objects=[vcpu_alloc, memory_mb_alloc] ) alloc_list.create_all() got_rps = rp_obj.ResourceProviderList._get_all_with_shared( self.context, resources, ) got_ids = [rp.id for rp in got_rps] self.assertEqual([cn1.id, cn2.id], got_ids)

commit_message:
MTU setting for OVSDpdkBond

This patch allows the MTU setting for DPDK bonds. In case of DPDK
bonds, the MTU setting needs to be done for each of the interfaces
attached to the bond.

Change-Id: Ida627313d14a674430b2aff3644fd62b2e0bcab7
Implements: blueprint ovs-2-6-features-dpdk
Signed-off-by: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/56/469056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # MTU is optional, used for jumbo frames mtu: 9000 # MTU is optional, used for jumbo frames mtu: 9000

subject: Rewrite redirection in cname_lookup & domain_remap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-19 13:10:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/3eccb4dc05c17e0531ddc87d462839a646792c0e', 'message': 'Rewrite redirection in cname_lookup & domain_remap

When cname_lookup, domain_remap and staticweb are used together, some
weird redirections could happens. Example:
 - original request: http://mysite.com/subdir
 - cname_lookup: http://cont.acct.storage.domain.com/subdir
 - domain_remap: http://cont.acct.storage.domain.com/v1/AUTH_acct/cont/subdir
 - staticweb:  http://cont.acct.storage.domain.com/v1/AUTH_acct/cont/subdir/
   (adding an ending /)

Bug #1: it used to not work because domain_remap always removed the
starting and ending slashes. So, staticweb would loop trying to append a
slash at the end of the request. Hopefully, the loop was broken by bug #2.

Bug #2: the redirection was not maintaining the original domain and
path. After the inital redirection, the request was rewritten again by
domain_remap into http://cont.acct.storage.domain.com
    + /v1/AUTH_acct/cont/subdir/v1/AUTH_acct/cont/subdir,
which ended up in a 404 error.

The patch fix bug #1 in domain_remap by appending the PATH_INFO as-is. It
is now possible to access access an object named "/v1" in a container
accessed by domain_remap.

Bug #2 is fixed in cname_lookup and domain_remap by catching the
redirection and replacing the rewritten domain/path by the originals
ones.

Closes-Bug: #1190625

Change-Id: I67f642b8b070bc21e7760477d0a1e3b902ba7896
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-23 10:06:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/dc344d70c36c154bffa96c295a0061aaff37e1ad', 'message': 'Rewrite redirection in cname_lookup & domain_remap

is now possible to access access an object named "/v1" in a container
accessed by domain_remap.

Bug #2 is fixed in cname_lookup and domain_remap by catching the
redirection and replacing the rewritten domain/path by the originals
ones.

Closes-Bug: #1190625

Change-Id: I67f642b8b070bc21e7760477d0a1e3b902ba7896

commit_message:
Rewrite redirection in cname_lookup & domain_remap

cname_lookup and domain_remap are currently not catching redirections
(eg: staticweb). This behavior makes the domain to change when a call
through cname_lookup and domain_remap end up being redirected. Example:
commit fixes it.
 - original request: http://mysite.com/subdir
 - redirected:  http://cont.acct.storage.domain.com/v1/AUTH_acct/cont/subdir/
 - expected: http://mysite.com/subdir/

This patch is fixing this.

Closes-Bug: #1190625
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I67f642b8b070bc21e7760477d0a1e3b902ba7896

added_lines: import re old_host = given_domain = env['HTTP_HOST'] else: old_host = given_domain = env['SERVER_NAME'] else: new_host = env['HTTP_HOST'] def _start_response(status, headers, exc_info=None): headers = dict(headers) if str(status)[0:4] in ('301 ', '302 ', '303 ', '307 ') \ and headers.get('Location'): headers['Location'] = re.sub( r'^(https?://)%s(/.*)?$' % new_host, r'\1%s\2' % old_host, headers['Location']) return start_response(status, list(headers.items()), exc_info) return self.app(env, _start_response)

commit_message:
Fix api extensions documentation

Previously these were pointing to the wrong locations.

This updates them to the correct controllers.

from the previous commit:
Ib1d4c23a64cbd0010c88ff77b97b1173da302bed

The point behind the addition of the stevedore.sphinxext extension is
"to document drivers and other types of plugins to make the available
sets built into projects easier to discover"(dhellman).

More details in the ML thread at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/073338.html

Closes-Bug: #1695037
Change-Id: I7e847222a7a6b592a6c0c86007585eba323dce7e

commit_message:
Restart docker after changing storage driver

This likely explains why CI appears to still be running the
devicemapper driver even though overlay2 is now the default.

Change-Id: Ic2d80bae1fddbdb1c80bae297031521dd78d896a
Closes-Bug: #1692502

commit_message:
WIP Dell EMC SC: Adding wait for DSM/Primary to Failback

Adding a wait for DSM/primary between loading up runs of five
replication volumes. If either go down we will only mark the current
in flight volumes as in error.

Change-Id: I549c38d81e10022b7b31702c3500a90d64f977de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/94/463394/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _wait_for_primary(self, api): # Just loop until things come back. # Should there be a time out? deadcount = 5 while deadcount: try: sc = api._find_sc(api.primaryssn) break except exception.VolumeBackendAPIException: # This is part of an async call so we should be good sleeping # here. # Have to balance hammering the backend for no good reason with # the max timeout for the unit tests. Yeah, silly. eventlet.sleep(self.failback_timeout) deadcount -= 1 # We start by seeing if our original SC is up. If not we # crash through with an exception. api._find_sc(api.primaryssn) # We hang out until we can run. self._wait_for_primary(api) # Do some work.

commit_message:
Configure migration SSH tunnel

This patch configures SSH tunneling for nova cold-migration and reuses the
tunnel for libvirt live-migration unless TLS has been enabled.

Change-Id: I367757cbe8757d11943af7e41af620f9ce919a06
Depends-On: Iac1763761c652bed637cb7cf85bc12347b5fe7ec

commit_message:
Refactor SSHD config to allow both SSHD options and banner/motd to be set

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444622/7 the sshd_options and banner/motd
are mutually exclusive. This patch, and the next patchset of that review,
resolves the conflict.

Related-Bug: 1668543

Change-Id: I1d09530d69e42c0c36311789166554a889e46556
(cherry picked from commit 3c49f51c8f42472d0d1cb2986b46a6c96821293a)

commit_message:
Stop SSHD profile clobbering SSH client config

Including the ::ssh manifest will manage both client and server config.
Managing the client config was not intended and will clobber the OS
default config with the puppet ssh moduled defaults.

Follow up for https://review.openstack.org/443113 where I found the issue after
the changes merged.

Change-Id: I6329f5ebbe8fc3950449e325e56293872d11e1b5
Related-Bug: 1668543
(cherry picked from commit 2a329d545d0e619c88c323148d5fe2098e70b4b1)
(cherry picked from commit f01cef046df57d5257560d3f83bef2e91c3c722e)

commit_message:
Drop -dev in preparation for Pike M2

We're coming up on the Pike M2 release and we need to prepare the
metadata.json and reno configuration for the release.

Change-Id: Ib2962c27ce011de9390493c33436d6c13d9ea78a

commit_message:
SSHD Service extensions

This change adds an `include` statement to bring in the extra
functionality available from the existing puppet-ssh module in
already available in RDO.

By using puppet-ssh it provides a framework to allow the passing in of
server options using just hiera values under ssh::server_options.
For example, sshd_config banner can now be passed a server option, as
well as all the new parameters outlined in the launchpad issue that
the patch references for Closing. For this reason, the former augeas
setting for `Banner /etc/issue` is now managed by the main puppet-ssh
module instead.

The change also allows population of MOTD text to `/etc/motd` as
well as `issue.net`.

$bannertext is refactored in accordance with patch [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/442406/

Depends-On: Idefe9f0de47c5b0f29b7326642d697ed179e2eb8
Change-Id: Id329538fb7b623526f1d91d8a513cf3440c86a7c
Related-Bug: 1668543
(cherry picked from commit b35bc80ac2acf18463e4c18c8360862749aa0964)
(cherry picked from commit 0e991f99b4b239838b5f775468f25025b3ad170b)

commit_message:
swarm: Add docker_volume_type label

* add docker_volume_type for the cinder volumes which are
  used for docker storage.
* add default_docker_volume_type configuration option

Related-Bug: #1678153
Change-Id: Ie18096acf24873ef91a904df4f1a84694a2bb644

To use the cinder volumes ' 'for docker storage, you need to select a default ' 'value.'))] conf.register_group(cinder_client_group) conf.register_opts(cinder_opts, group=cinder_group) conf.register_opts(cinder_client_opts, group=cinder_client_group) cinder_group: cinder_opts, cinder_client_group: cinder_client_opts

subject: integrate trait cache with TraitList and Trait
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-05 01:16:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8bb346fce11a2e2c411753903004b107798770a9', 'message': 'integrate trait cache with TraitList and Trait

This patch wires up the TraitCache with the Trait-related objects in
nova/objects/resource_provider.py. Like the resource class cache, we use a
singleton object at the module scope and have an _ensure_trait_cache() function
that ensures the cache is filled and operational for any operations that use
it.

We change the Trait.get_by_name() method to only use the newly-installed trait
cache instead of hitting the DB, and we ensure that when destroying a trait we
clear the trait cache to trigger a refresh of it and ensure no stale reads of
deleted custom traits.

Change-Id: Ia90afa6ebc17a23226011cd6445e749ea1f26158
blueprint: resource-provider-traits

commit_message:
integrate trait cache with TraitList and Trait

This patch wires up the TraitCache with the Trait-related objects in
nova/objects/resource_provider.py. Like the resource class cache, we use
a singleton object at the module scope and have an _ensure_trait_cache()
function that ensures the cache is filled and operational for any
operations that use it.

We change the Trait.get_by_name() method to only use the newly-installed
trait cache instead of hitting the DB, and we ensure that when
destroying a trait we clear the trait cache to trigger a refresh of it
and ensure no stale reads of deleted custom traits.

Change-Id: Ia90afa6ebc17a23226011cd6445e749ea1f26158
blueprint: resource-provider-traits

Upon creation, the cache reads all traits from the os_traits library, reads all

commit_message:
add cache which keeps DB and os_traits in sync

Adds a cache similar to nova/db/sqlalchemy/resource_class_cache.py that
serves as a simple facade over the API DB traits table and the os_traits
library.

Upon creation, the cache reads all traits from the os_traits library,
reads all traits from the API DB (that are not custom traits) and
batch-inserts any os_traits traits into the DB that are missing.

There's no lazy-loading single traits. Instead, the cache uses the same
strategy as the resource class cache. When a trait ID or string is
requested that the cache doesn't know about, it simply re-reads the
entire collection of trait identifiers and names from the database and
refreshes its internal maps of integer to string identifiers. The sync
with os_traits is only done on construction of a TraitsCache, which a
followup patch will add to the nova/objects/resource_provider.py module
(similar to the _RC_CACHE singleton that exists there for resource
classes).

Since os_traits traits only need to be sync'd to the DB when a new
os_traits library is deployed, and since the Nova services would
necessarily need to be restarted in order to pick up the new version of
os_traits, there's no need to have the _sync_standard_traits() routine
run on anything other than the cache constructor.

Change-Id: I729e84ea0ff8f333a156b24b15fe4d368209d015
blueprint: resource-provider-traits
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/462769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os_traits from oslo_concurrency import lockutils from oslo_log import log as logging import six import sqlalchemy as sa from nova.db.sqlalchemy import api as db_api from nova.db.sqlalchemy import api_models as models from nova import exception LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) _TRAIT_TBL = models.Trait.__table__ _LOCKNAME = 'trait_cache' @db_api.api_context_manager.writer def _sync_standard_traits(ctx): """Reads all symbols from the os_traits library, checks if any of them do not exist in the database (and therefore have an internal integer identifier) and bulk-inserts any that are not in the DB. """ std_traits = set(os_traits.get_traits()) conn = ctx.session.connection() sel = sa.select([_TRAIT_TBL.c.name]) res = conn.execute(sel).fetchall() db_traits = set( r[0] for r in res if not os_traits.is_custom(r[0]) ) need_sync = std_traits - db_traits ins = _TRAIT_TBL.insert() batch_args = [ {'name': six.text_type(trait)} for trait in need_sync ] conn.execute(ins, batch_args) LOG.info("Synced traits from os_traits into API DB: %s", need_sync) @db_api.api_context_manager.reader def _refresh_from_db(ctx, cache): """Grabs all traits from the DB table and populates the supplied cache object's internal integer and string identifier dicts. :param cache: TraitCache object to refresh. """ conn = ctx.session.connection() sel = sa.select([_TRAIT_TBL.c.id, _TRAIT_TBL.c.name]) res = conn.execute(sel).fetchall() cache.id_cache = {r[1]: r[0] for r in res} cache.str_cache = {r[0]: r[1] for r in res} class TraitCache(object): """A cache of integer and string lookup values for traits.""" def __init__(self, ctx): """Initialize the cache of trait identifiers. :param ctx: `nova.context.RequestContext` from which we can grab a `SQLAlchemy.Connection` object to use for any DB lookups. """ self.ctx = ctx self.id_cache = {} self.str_cache = {} _sync_standard_traits(self.ctx) def clear(self): with lockutils.lock(_LOCKNAME): self.id_cache = {} self.str_cache = {} def id_from_string(self, trait_str): """Given a string representation of a trait -- e.g. "STORAGE_DISK_SSD" or "CUSTOM_PURPLE" -- return the integer code for the trait. :param trait_str: The string representation of the trait to look up a numeric identifier for. :returns integer identifier for the trait, or None, if no such trait was found. :raises `exception.TraitNotFound` if trait_str cannot be found. """ with lockutils.lock(_LOCKNAME): if trait_str in self.id_cache: return self.id_cache[trait_str] # Otherwise, check the database table _refresh_from_db(self.ctx, self) if trait_str in self.id_cache: return self.id_cache[trait_str] raise exception.TraitNotFound(trait=trait_str) def string_from_id(self, trait_id): """The reverse of the id_from_string() method. Given a supplied numeric identifier for a trait, we return that associated string representation. :param trait_id: The numeric representation of the trait to look up a string identifier for. :returns: string identifier for the trait, or None, if no such trait was found. :raises `exception.TraitNotFound` if trait_id cannot be found. """ with lockutils.lock(_LOCKNAME): if trait_id in self.str_cache: return self.str_cache[trait_id] # Otherwise, check the database table _refresh_from_db(self.ctx, self) if trait_id in self.str_cache: return self.str_cache[trait_id] raise exception.TraitNotFound(trait=trait_id)

Skip broken setuptools 36.0.0

Recently released setuptools breaks all projects' CI tests,
need block version 36.0.0. For more details, please refer to
upstream issue: https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/1042

Change-Id: Ieb889762f43de042f6a9c659cf24c16682321a47

commit_message:
do not include remote name in branch spec for release notes

Reno will add the origin prefix if there is no local branch with the
desired name.

Change-Id: I76cc3199edacc4e35af44e01c57720100faee529
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix 'introspection bulk status' when some nodes were never introspected

Previously we did not handle exceptions from ironic_inspector_client, so nodes
that were never introspected (e.g. ones in maintenance mode) caused this
command to fail.

Change-Id: I58756256fe70992ff5618a3f307ce34f95e71efd
Closes-Bug: #1689540
(cherry picked from commit 759dff71d892fcf21ee841cd0a8aee837b519f76)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/35/467935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The ``introspection bulk status`` command no longer aborts if some nodes in the Ironic registry were never introspected. See bug `1689540 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1689540>`_.

commit_message:
Drop -dev in preparation for Pike M2

We're coming up on the Pike M2 release and we need to prepare the
metadata.json and reno configuration for the release.

Change-Id: I63c46ce94fa0d3411989038cde9e0d8222956d05

commit_message:
Drop -dev in preparation for Pike M2

We're coming up on the Pike M2 release and we need to prepare the
metadata.json and reno configuration for the release.

Change-Id: I9fad92da45f4f8daafa1b492c45463243be64df4

subject: placement: shared resources when finding providers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-02 00:30:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/597c5d45cf1b7404dfe1e7528d16a7389aa5cb97', 'message': 'placement: shared resources when finding providers

This patch implements the query construction for finding resource providers in
a Nova deployment with shared resource providers.

When ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters() fails to find any resource
providers using its normal "find me all the resource providers that have
capacioty for all of these resources" query, we fall into a new
_get_all_with_shared() method that constructs an advanced SQL expression that
takes into account providers that share resource with other providers via an
aggregate association.

The SQL generated here is pretty complex so I've included ample code comments
showing the logic of how the join expressions are built up, one on top of the
other.

To give an idea of the SQL generated from this new approach, here is what is
constructed for an environment with a shared storage pool and some compute
nodes having RAM and vCPU:

SELECT rp.*
FROM resource_providers AS rp,
 resource_provider_aggregates AS sharing_disk_gb,
INNER JOIN inventories AS inv_vcpu
 ON rp.id = inv_vcpu.resource_provider_id
 AND inv_vcpu.resource_class_id = $VCPU_ID
LEFT JOIN (
 SELECT resource_provider_id, SUM(used) AS used
 FROM allocations
 WHERE resource_class_id = $VCPU_ID
 GROUP BY resource_provider_id
) AS usage_vcpu
 ON inv_vcpu.resource_provider_id = \
      usage_vcpu.resource_provider_id
INNER JOIN inventories AS inv_memory_mb
ON inv_vcpu.resource_provider_id = inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id
AND inv_memory_mb.resource_class_id = $MEMORY_MB_ID
LEFT JOIN (
 SELECT resource_provider_id, SUM(used) AS used
 FROM allocations
 WHERE resource_class_id = $MEMORY_MB_ID
 GROUP BY resource_provider_id
) AS usage_memory_mb
 ON inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id = \
      usage_memory_mb.resource_provider_id
LEFT JOIN inventories AS inv_disk_gb
 ON inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id = \
      inv_disk_gb.resource_provider_id
 AND inv_disk_gb.resource_class_id = $DISK_GB_ID
LEFT JOIN (
 SELECT resource_provider_id, SUM(used) AS used
 FROM allocations
 WHERE resource_class_id = $DISK_GB_ID
 GROUP BY resource_provider_id
) AS usage_disk_gb
 ON inv_disk_gb.resource_provider_id = \
      usage_disk_gb.resource_provider_id
LEFT JOIN resource_provider_aggregates AS shared_disk_gb
 ON inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id = \
      shared_disk.resource_provider_id
LEFT JOIN resource_provider_aggregates AS sharing_disk_gb
 ON shared_disk_gb.aggregate_id = sharing_disk_gb.aggregate_id
WHERE sharing_disk_gb.resource_provider_id IN ($RPS_SHARING_DISK)
AND (
  (
    COALESCE(usage_vcpu.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_VCPU <=
    (inv_vcpu.total + inv_vcpu.reserved)
    * inv_vcpu.allocation_ratio
  ) AND
  inv_vcpu.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_VCPU AND
  inv_vcpu.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_VCPU AND
  $AMOUNT_VCPU % inv_vcpu.step_size = 0
) AND (
  (
    COALESCE(usage_memory_mb.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_VCPU <=
    (inv_memory_mb.total + inv_memory_mb.reserved)
    * inv_memory_mb.allocation_ratio
  ) AND
  inv_memory_mb.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB AND
  inv_memory_mb.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB AND
  $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB % inv_memory_mb.step_size = 0
) AND (
  inv_disk_gb.resource_provider_id IS NOT NULL AND
  (
    (
      COALESCE(usage_disk_gb.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_DISK_GB <=
        (inv_disk_gb.total + inv_disk_gb.reserved)
        * inv_disk_gb.allocation_ratio
    ) AND
    inv_disk_gb.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_DISK_GB AND
    inv_disk_gb.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_DISK_GB AND
    $AMOUNT_DISK_GB % inv_disk_gb.step_size = 0
  ) OR
    shared_disk_gb.resource_provider_id IS NOT NULL
)
GROUP BY rp.id

While the above may look hairy, the query plan produce is remarkably efficient.
Tested on a database populated with 10K compute nodes arranged in 100
aggregates each with an associated storage pool, a MySQL server with minimal
RAM (128MB InnoDB buffer pool size) was able to execute the above in an average
of .38s, with the resulting query plan showing indexes being used to satisfy
all join conditions:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/608553/

Change-Id: Icd95b2754303a5efd47177eded0baaad56d91677

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-05-03 18:10:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5ebdddf5f08bf8ef522e4a26fd355fbbd6e60456', 'message': "placement: shared resources when finding providers

This patch implements the query construction for finding resource providers in
a Nova deployment with shared resource providers. A new _get_all_with_shared()
function constructs an advanced SQL expression that takes into account
providers that share resource with other providers via an aggregate
association.

The SQL generated here is pretty complex so I've included ample code comments
showing the logic of how the join expressions are built up, one on top of the
other.

To give an idea of the SQL generated from this new approach, here is what is
constructed for an environment with a shared storage pool and some compute
nodes having RAM and vCPU:

SELECT rp.*
FROM resource_providers AS rp
INNER JOIN inventories AS inv_vcpu
 ON rp.id = inv_vcpu.resource_provider_id
 AND inv_vcpu.resource_class_id = $VCPU_ID
LEFT JOIN (
 SELECT resource_provider_id, SUM(used) AS used
 FROM allocations
 WHERE resource_class_id = $VCPU_ID
 GROUP BY resource_provider_id
) AS usage_vcpu
 ON inv_vcpu.resource_provider_id = \
      usage_vcpu.resource_provider_id
INNER JOIN inventories AS inv_memory_mb
ON inv_vcpu.resource_provider_id = inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id
AND inv_memory_mb.resource_class_id = $MEMORY_MB_ID
LEFT JOIN (
 SELECT resource_provider_id, SUM(used) AS used
 FROM allocations
 WHERE resource_class_id = $MEMORY_MB_ID
 GROUP BY resource_provider_id
) AS usage_memory_mb
 ON inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id = \
      usage_memory_mb.resource_provider_id
LEFT JOIN inventories AS inv_disk_gb
 ON inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id = \
      inv_disk_gb.resource_provider_id
 AND inv_disk_gb.resource_class_id = $DISK_GB_ID
LEFT JOIN (
 SELECT resource_provider_id, SUM(used) AS used
 FROM allocations
 WHERE resource_class_id = $DISK_GB_ID
 GROUP BY resource_provider_id
) AS usage_disk_gb
 ON inv_disk_gb.resource_provider_id = \
      usage_disk_gb.resource_provider_id
LEFT JOIN resource_provider_aggregates AS shared_disk_gb
 ON inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id = \
      shared_disk.resource_provider_id
LEFT JOIN resource_provider_aggregates AS sharing_disk_gb
 ON shared_disk_gb.aggregate_id = sharing_disk_gb.aggregate_id
AND sharing_disk_gb.resource_provider_id IN ($RPS_SHARING_DISK)
WHERE (
  (
    COALESCE(usage_vcpu.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_VCPU <=
    (inv_vcpu.total + inv_vcpu.reserved)
    * inv_vcpu.allocation_ratio
  ) AND
  inv_vcpu.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_VCPU AND
  inv_vcpu.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_VCPU AND
  $AMOUNT_VCPU % inv_vcpu.step_size = 0
) AND (
  (
    COALESCE(usage_memory_mb.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_VCPU <=
    (inv_memory_mb.total + inv_memory_mb.reserved)
    * inv_memory_mb.allocation_ratio
  ) AND
  inv_memory_mb.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB AND
  inv_memory_mb.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB AND
  $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB % inv_memory_mb.step_size = 0
) AND (
  inv_disk_gb.resource_provider_id IS NOT NULL AND
  (
    (
      COALESCE(usage_disk_gb.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_DISK_GB <=
        (inv_disk_gb.total + inv_disk_gb.reserved)
        * inv_disk_gb.allocation_ratio
    ) AND
    inv_disk_gb.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_DISK_GB AND
    inv_disk_gb.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_DISK_GB AND
    $AMOUNT_DISK_GB % inv_disk_gb.step_size = 0
  ) OR
    shared_disk_gb.aggregate_id IS NOT NULL
)
GROUP BY rp.id

While the above may look hairy, the query plan produced is remarkably
efficient.  Tested on a database populated with 10K compute nodes arranged in
100 aggregates each with an associated storage pool, a MySQL server with
minimal RAM (128MB InnoDB buffer pool size) was able to execute the above in an
average of 0.38s, with the resulting query plan showing indexes being used to
satisfy all join conditions:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/608553/

blueprint: shared-resources-pike

Change-Id: Icd95b2754303a5efd47177eded0baaad56d91677

 AND inv_disk_gb.resource_class_id = $DISK_GB_ID
LEFT JOIN (
 SELECT resource_provider_id, SUM(used) AS used
 FROM allocations
 WHERE resource_class_id = $DISK_GB_ID
 GROUP BY resource_provider_id
) AS usage_disk_gb
 ON inv_disk_gb.resource_provider_id = \
      usage_disk_gb.resource_provider_id
LEFT JOIN resource_provider_aggregates AS shared_disk_gb
 ON inv_memory_mb.resource_provider_id = \
      shared_disk.resource_provider_id
LEFT JOIN resource_provider_aggregates AS sharing_disk_gb
 ON shared_disk_gb.aggregate_id = sharing_disk_gb.aggregate_id
AND sharing_disk_gb.resource_provider_id IN ($RPS_SHARING_DISK)
WHERE (
  (
    COALESCE(usage_vcpu.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_VCPU <=
    (inv_vcpu.total + inv_vcpu.reserved)
    * inv_vcpu.allocation_ratio
  ) AND
  inv_vcpu.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_VCPU AND
  inv_vcpu.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_VCPU AND
  $AMOUNT_VCPU % inv_vcpu.step_size = 0
) AND (
  (
    COALESCE(usage_memory_mb.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_VCPU <=
    (inv_memory_mb.total + inv_memory_mb.reserved)
    * inv_memory_mb.allocation_ratio
  ) AND
  inv_memory_mb.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB AND
  inv_memory_mb.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB AND
  $AMOUNT_MEMORY_MB % inv_memory_mb.step_size = 0
) AND (
  inv_disk_gb.resource_provider_id IS NOT NULL AND
  (
    (
      COALESCE(usage_disk_gb.used, 0) + $AMOUNT_DISK_GB <=
        (inv_disk_gb.total + inv_disk_gb.reserved)
        * inv_disk_gb.allocation_ratio
    ) AND
    inv_disk_gb.min_unit <= $AMOUNT_DISK_GB AND
    inv_disk_gb.max_unit >= $AMOUNT_DISK_GB AND
    $AMOUNT_DISK_GB % inv_disk_gb.step_size = 0
  ) OR
    shared_disk_gb.aggregate_id IS NOT NULL
)
GROUP BY rp.id

While the above may look hairy, the query plan produced is remarkably
efficient.  Tested on a database populated with 10K compute nodes arranged in
100 aggregates each with an associated storage pool, a MySQL server with
minimal RAM (128MB InnoDB buffer pool size) was able to execute the above in an
average of 0.38s, with the resulting query plan showing indexes being used to
satisfy all join conditions:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/608553/

blueprint: shared-resources-pike

Change-Id: Icd95b2754303a5efd47177eded0baaad56d91677

commit_message:
placement: shared resources when finding providers

This patch implements the query construction for finding resource
providers in a Nova deployment with shared resource providers. A new
_get_all_with_shared() function constructs an advanced SQL expression
that takes into account providers that share resource with other
providers via an aggregate association.

The SQL generated here is pretty complex so I've included ample code
comments showing the logic of how the join expressions are built up,
one on top of the other.

The query plan produced is efficient.  Tested on a database populated
with 10K compute nodes arranged in 100 aggregates each with an
associated storage pool, a MySQL server with minimal RAM (128MB InnoDB
buffer pool size) was able to execute the above in an average of 0.38s,
with the resulting query plan showing indexes being used to satisfy all
join conditions:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/608553/

blueprint: shared-resources-pike

Change-Id: Icd95b2754303a5efd47177eded0baaad56d91677
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/461574/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_all_with_shared(self): """We set up two compute nodes with VCPU and MEMORY_MB only, a shared resource provider having DISK_GB inventory, and associate all of them with an aggregate. We then call the ResourceProviderList._get_all_with_shared() function to ensure that we get back the two compute node resource provider records. """ # The aggregate that will be associated to everything... agg_uuid = uuidsentinel.agg # Create the two compute node providers cn1_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn1 cn1 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='cn1', uuid=cn1_uuid, ) cn1.create() cn2_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn2 cn2 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='cn2', uuid=cn2_uuid, ) cn2.create() # Populate the two compute node providers with inventory, sans DISK_GB for cn in (cn1, cn2): vcpu = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, total=24, reserved=0, min_unit=1, max_unit=24, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=16.0, ) memory_mb = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, total=1024, reserved=0, min_unit=64, max_unit=1024, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=1.5, ) inv_list = objects.InventoryList(objects=[vcpu, memory_mb]) cn.set_inventory(inv_list) # Create the shared storage pool ss_uuid = uuidsentinel.ss ss = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='shared storage', uuid=ss_uuid, ) ss.create() # Give the shared storage pool some inventory of DISK_GB disk_gb = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=ss, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=2000, reserved=0, min_unit=10, max_unit=100, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=1.0, ) inv_list = objects.InventoryList(objects=[disk_gb]) ss.set_inventory(inv_list) # Mark the shared storage pool as having inventory shared among any # provider associated via aggregate t = objects.Trait( self.context, name="MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE", ) # TODO(jaypipes): Once MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE is a standard # os-traits trait, we won't need to create() here. Instead, we will # just do: # t = objects.Trait.get_by_name( # self.context, # "MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE", # ) t.create() ss.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t])) # Now associate the shared storage pool and both compute nodes with the # same aggregate cn1.set_aggregates([agg_uuid]) cn2.set_aggregates([agg_uuid]) ss.set_aggregates([agg_uuid]) # OK, now that has all been set up, let's verify that we get the ID of # the shared storage pool when we ask for 10 DISK_GB STANDARDS = fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD VCPU_ID = STANDARDS.index(fields.ResourceClass.VCPU) MEMORY_MB_ID = STANDARDS.index(fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB) DISK_GB_ID = STANDARDS.index(fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB) resources = { VCPU_ID: 1, MEMORY_MB_ID: 64, DISK_GB_ID: 100, } got_rps = rp_obj.ResourceProviderList._get_all_with_shared( self.context, resources, ) got_ids = set(rp.id for rp in got_rps) self.assertEqual(set([cn1.id, cn2.id]), got_ids)

commit_message:
Add netcat to distro packages

In order to support the use of the Ansible
haproxy module to enable/disable backends
during the execution of configuration and/or
software changes, the required [1] netcat
package is installed.

[1] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/haproxy_module.html#notes

Change-Id: Id80dfc8f75f2efdb35b19c4e6bb899475623d824

commit_message:
Use get_notification_transport for notifications

oslo messaging's get_transport is not intended for
notifications, we should be using get_notification_transport
instead. This patch set adds that change.

If settings in manila.conf oslo_messaging_notifications are not
set, this will fallback to default configs.

Change-Id: Ic65f043086f38d930973ee52ca9ff210e27ece99
Closes-Bug: #1694776

deleted_lines: global TRANSPORT, NOTIFIER NOTIFIER = messaging.Notifier(TRANSPORT, serializer=serializer) global TRANSPORT, NOTIFIER TRANSPORT = NOTIFIER = None

commit_message:
ovs: bubble up failures into main thread in native ofctl mode

When native ofctl interface is used (the default), the agent main() is
running in a separate gevent thread. Unless we explicitly request from
ryu to raise errors that may have happened in the agent app, it will
ignore them (only logging a warning message). This may interfere with
service management software like systemd that may use the return code to
decide whether to restart the dead service.

This patch makes ryu raise any uncaught errors happening inside the
agent. It also makes the agent 'wrapper' helper function not to swallow
raised exceptions on logging the error. Those two changes combined make
the agent exit with rc=1 if an exception happens inside the main()
function when in native mode.

This patch doesn't include any unit tests because those would be very
silly (like checking that we indeed pass the needed arguments to ryu).

Change-Id: Ic86b5eeae25a916c3c51f21e6820f5b0212dd5f8
Closes-Bug: #1694505
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/31/469231/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: LOG.exception(_LE("Agent main thread died of an exception")) return hub.spawn(agent_main_wrapper, bridge_classes)

commit_message:
add featureset config for a containerised overcloud

Change-Id: Id29504905329b04f90c13c78c737366d1d505709
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/51/446151/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Summary of the feature set. # Deploy an Openstack environment with a containerised overcloud # Tell tripleo how we want things done. # Note: The order of the templates and arguments passed to heat matters. extra_args: >- --ntp-server pool.ntp.org network_isolation: true network_isolation_type: 'single-nic-vlans' enable_pacemaker: false overcloud_ipv6: false containerized_overcloud: true # 192.168.23.1 is the dns server on the virthost # 8.8.8.8 also works across virthost and ovb env containers_compute_dns_server: 8.8.8.8 # This enables TLS for the undercloud which will also make haproxy bind to the # configured public-vip and admin-vip. undercloud_generate_service_certificate: false # This enables the deployment of the overcloud with SSL. ssl_overcloud: false # If `run_tempest` is `true`, run tempests tests, otherwise do not # run them. tempest_config: false test_ping: true run_tempest: false tempest_workers: 4 # Config for custom tripleo-heat-templates, used in overcloud-prep-config # overcloud_templates_path: /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates # overcloud_templates_repo: https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates # use templates_branch when not testing with an unmerged review # overcloud_templates_branch: master # use templates_refspec when testing with an unmerged review # overcloud_templates_refspec: # options below direct automatic doc generation by tripleo-collect-logs artcl_gen_docs: true artcl_create_docs_payload: included_deployment_scripts: - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - overcloud-prep-containers - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate included_static_docs: - env-setup-virt table_of_contents: - env-setup-virt - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - overcloud-prep-containers - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate

commit_message:
Remove lb_network_name from config (it was bogus)

This option was NEVER read, so there is no point in continuing to allow
it to be configured (it is pointless).

Change-Id: I147abdd8d3d95164168ec606f5b92401cb24d1fe
Closes-Bug: #1691286

commit_message:
Stop enforcing translations on logs

Translations team has stopped translating the logs. We need to
stop enforcing the usage of translation functions on logging.

Change-Id: I56900846ce8ea92eaa3873f64b383a36a4974908

commit_message:
Fix pool response to fill healthmonitor_id properly

This means both renaming the field to healthmonitor_id and also adding
the code to fill it.
Also rename health_monitor objects to healthmonitor for consistency.

Change-Id: I4c3deb9ad20f5089168030f27fc0929155379585
Closes-Bug: #1693044

commit_message:
protect against repos where we can't get project name

Some of the older released versions of projects don't work when we run
'python setup.py --name' (disk-image-builder was the main one I
noticed). This patch protects against those exceptions, and reports them
as warnings if the release is already tagged and errors if it is a new
release.

Change-Id: Iaa47e7ea2a52efee200e8c710c3660a7893b5147
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

added_lines: version_exists = gitutils.tag_exists( project['repo'], release['version'], ) try: sdist = pythonutils.get_sdist_name(workdir, project['repo']) except Exception as err: msg = 'Could not get the name of {} for version {}: {}'.format( project['repo'], release['version'], err) if version_exists: # If there was a problem with an existing # release, treat it as a warning so we # don't prevent new releases. mk_warning(msg) else: mk_error(msg) else: if sdist is not None: expected = project.get( 'tarball-base', os.path.basename(project['repo']), ) if sdist != expected: if 'tarball-base' in project: action = 'is set to' else: action = 'defaults to' mk_error( ('tarball-base for %s %s %s %r ' 'but the sdist name is actually %r. ' + _PLEASE) % (project['repo'], release['version'], action, expected, sdist))
